caption.title: PCDH19 is proteolytically processed in neurons in an activity dependent manner
caption.p: A. Schematic of the PCDH19 protein indicating known domains and expected sizes after proteolytic processing. NTF: N-terminal fragment; CTF: C-terminal fragment; NLS: nuclear localization signal; CM: conserved motif; WIRS: WAVE interacting receptor sequence.
B. Illustration of the luciferase reporter assay to investigate PCDH19 processing.

C. Quantification (mean ± SEM) of the luciferase reporter assay in HEK293 cells. Results are shown normalized to the IFNaR1 (negative) control. IFNaR2 is a positive control known to be constitutively processed. (N=6)
D. Western blot detection (top) and quantification (bottom) of full length and processed PCDH19 in mESC-derived neurons under control, ionomycin or ionomycin + GI254023X treatments. (N=3)

E. Western blot detection (top) and quantification (bottom) of full length and processed CDH2 in mESC-derived neurons under control, ionomycin or ionomycin + GI254023X treatments. Same lysates as in panel A. (N=3)

F. Western blot detection (top) and quantification (bottom) of full length and processed PCDH19 in mESC-derived neurons under control, ionomycin, ionomycin + MK-8931 or ionomycin + BB-94 treatments. (N=3)
G. Western blot detection (top) and quantification (bottom) of full length and processed PCDH19 in mESC-derived neurons under control, DAPT and Calpeptin treatments. (N=3)
H. WB detection of PCDH19 in E11 cortical lysates and P10 cortical (CTX, C) and hippocampal (H) lysates of Pcdh19 WT and KO mice.
I. Western blot detection (top) and quantification (bottom) of full length and processed PCDH19 in mESC-derived neurons under control, NMDA and NMDA + MK-801 treatments. (N=3)

Data information: (C) The ratio of Firefly to Renilla luciferase was used for quantification. (D-I) The ratio of CTF to FL band intensity was used for quantification. Data are normalized to IM treatment (D, E, F), control (G) or NMDA treatment (I) for ease of visualization and are presented as mean ± SEM. N: Biological replicate. Relevant p-values are indicated: *p < 0.05, **p < 0.01, ***p < 0.001, ****P < 0.0001. Statistical analysis: one-way ANOVA with Tukey’s post-hoc test on non-normalized values.

caption.title: PCDH19 ICD localizes to the nucleus after cleavage.
caption.p: A, B. mESC-derived neurons transfected with PCDH19FL-HA (A) or PCDH19ICD-HA (B). Representative confocal images of transfected cells immunostained for HA. Nuclei are counterstained with DAPI. Scale bars: 20 μm (overview, top rows), 10 μm (inserts, bottom rows).

B. In utero electroporation to express PCDH19 ICD in upper layer cortical neurons. Strategy (top) and representative confocal images of a layer II/III neuron immunostained for HA for the control (pCIG) and 19ICD-HA conditions. Scale bar: 20 μm.

C. In utero electroporation to target endogenous PCDH19 with an HA tag. Strategy (top), targeting vector (middle) and representative confocal images of a layer II/III neuron immunostained for HA. Scale bars: 20 μm left panel, 10 μm middle and right panels.

D. Representative images of control and treated cells immunostained for HA (right) and quantification (left) of HeLa cells transfected with PCDH19FL-HA and subjected to a 20 min ionomycin treatment. Nuclei are counterstained with DAPI (blue). Relative nuclear fluorescence was quantified, mean ± SEM is displayed (N=15). Scale bar: 20 μm.

E. Western blot detection of full length and processed PCDH19 in cytoplasm/nucleus (C/N) and membrane (Mb) enriched fractions of MEF lysates (right). A western blot to verify the subcellular fractionation of MEF lysates into cytoplasm/nucleus and membrane enriched fractions is shown on the left.

Data information: Relative nuclear fluorescence was obtained by dividing nuclear fluorescence by the sum of nuclear and cytoplasmic fluorescence. N: individual cells. ***p < 0.001. Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney test.

caption.title: PCDH19 ICD interacts with importins for nuclear transport.
caption.p: A. Co-IPs of PCDH19FL (left) and PCDH19-ICD (right) with importin α1 (KPNA1).

B. HeLa cells transfected with PCDH19ICD-HA or PCDH19ICD-HA with a mutated NLS, and subjected to a 20 min ionomycin treatment. Representative confocal images of transfected cells immunostained for HA (left). Nuclei are counterstained with DAPI. Relative nuclear fluorescence was quantified, mean ± SEM is displayed (right, N=15). Scale bar: 20 μm.
C. Co-IP of PCDH19 and KPNA1 from P10 cortical lysates. Ips were performed with anti-PCDH19, anti-KPNA1 and IgG.

Data information: Relative nuclear fluorescence was obtained by dividing nuclear fluorescence by the sum of nuclear and cytoplasmic fluorescence. N: Individual cells. ****p < 0.0001. Statistical analysis: unpaired two-tailed Student’s t-test.

caption.title: Generation of a new mESC-line to investigate the nuclear function of PCDH19-ICD.
caption.p: A. Experimental strategy.
B. Schematic of the targeting of the Rosa26 locus to express PCDH19-ICD-HA.
C. WB of mESCs subclones, showing successful (1.2 and 1.18) and unsuccessful (1.3) targeting of the Rosa26 locus. All clones express PCDH19, but only 1.2 and 1.18 show expression of PCDH19-ICD-HA.
D. DIV12 Neurons derived from 19ICD-OE mESCs stained for MAP2 (green) and HA (red). Nuclei are counterstained with DAPI (blue). Scale bar: 20 μm.
E. Pcdh19 exon usage. Normalised counts plotted along genomic coordinates of Pcdh19 in DIV8 mESC-derived neurons (blue: WT (N=3), red: 19ICD-HA (N=3)).

F. Principal component analysis on RNAseq results of DIV8 and DIV12 neuronal samples determined with DESeq2. Shapes indicate time points (DIV8, DIV12), colors indicate cell-lines (WT, 19ICD-OE) and alpha scale indicates samples belonging to each of the three independent differentiations (1, 2, 3).

G. Correlation matrix showing hierarchical clustering of samples based on expression of all genes, determined with DESeq2. Blue scale represents distance between samples, with darker blue corresponding to smaller distances.

H. Venn diagram with total numbers of DEGs and comparison of common and unique up- and downregulated genes between WT (N=3) and 19ICD-OE (N=3) at DIV8 and DIV12, determined by RNAseq. The number of up- and downregulated genes is indicated by upward and downward arrows, respectively.
I. Expression levels of differentially expressed genes in mESC-derived neurons at DIV8 and DIV12, determined by RT-PCR (N=3).

Data information: cDNA quantity was obtained using a standard curve. For each of the 3 samples obtained from independent differentiations, 3 technical replicates were run, and their results were averaged. Data are presented as mean ± SEM. N: biological replicates (independent differentiations). Relevant P-values are indicated: *p < 0.05, **p < 0.01. Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney test (Zic1 DIV8); unpaired two-tailed Student’s t-test (rest).

caption.title: Overexpression of PCDH19-ICD leads to transcriptional changes in neuronal differentiation-related genes in mESC-derived neurons.
caption.p: A. Top 15 Biological Process GO-terms enriched among the differentially expressed genes at DIV8 as determined by gProfiler. Log(FDR) values are shown for each term. Common top 15 BP GO-terms between gProfiler, ShinyGO and Panther are highlighted in bold.
B. Log(FDR) values for the GO-terms “neurogenesis”, “generation of neurons” and “neuron differentiation” at DIV12 across gProfiler, ShinyGO and Panther.

C. Top 15 Cellular Compartment GO-terms enriched among the differentially expressed genes at DIV8 as determined by gProfiler. Log(FDR) values are shown for each term. Common top 15 CC GO-terms between gProfiler, ShinyGO and Panther are highlighted in bold.
D. Venn diagram displaying the number of common and unique DEGs related to the three selected GO-terms at DIV8 and DIV12.
E. Diagram depicting the total number of DEGs for the GO-terms “neurogenesis”, “generation of neurons” and “neuron differentiation”, and how they relate to each other at DIV8 and DIV12.

F. List of significantly up- and downregulated genes between DIV8 WT and 19ICD-OE mESC-derived neurons related to the GO-term “neuronal differentiation” as determined by RNAseq. Genes are classified into transcription factors, membrane proteins and others, and their log2 fold change is depicted in green (upregulated) or pink (downregulated).

caption.title: In vivo overexpression of PCDH19 ICD does not affect neuronal number, position or axonal trajectories of upper layer cortical neurons.
caption.p: A. In utero electroporation to express PCDH19 ICD in upper layer cortical neurons. Strategy (top) and representative confocal images of electroporated brains immunostained for HA for the control (pCIG) and experimental (pCIG-19ICD-HA) conditions. Cortical layers are indicated with roman numerals. Scale bar: 200 μm.
B. Quantification (mean ± SEM) of the total number of electroporated neurons (top) and cortical thickness (bottom) for pCIG (N=7) and pCIG-19ICD-HA (N=11) brains.
C. Kernel density analysis of the distribution of electroporated cells for pCIG and pCIG-19ICD-HA electroporated brains.

D-E. Representative confocal images of the whole cortex of a pCIG (D) and a pCIG-19ICD-HA (E) electroporated brain showing axonal trajectories for the targeted neurons. Higher magnifications of the electroporated area (D’, E’), corpus callosum (D”, E”) and contralateral hemisphere (D”’, E”’) are also shown. CTX: cortex, HIP: hippocampus, CC: corpus callosum. Scale bars: 500 μm for whole cortex, 200 μm for specific areas.

Data information: N: Biological replicate (electroporated brain). (B) Statistical analysis: unpaired two-tailed Student’s t-test. No statistically significant differences identified. (C) Kernel density analysis was performed on pooled data for N=7 and N=11 electroporated brains for pCIG and pCIG-19ICD-HA, respectively. Statistical analysis: Kolmogorov-Smirnoff test between histogram distributions of neuronal positions using 50 μm bins. No statistically significant differences identified.

caption.title: In vivo overexpression of PCDH19 ICD reduces spine density without affecting dendritic morphology.
caption.p: A. Maximum intensity projections of confocal stacks showing individual upper layer neurons targeted with pCIG (left) or pCIG-19ICD-HA (right). Scale bar: 50 μm.
B. Examples of traced neurons electroporated with pCIG (top) or pCIG-19ICD-HA (bottom).
C. Quantification (mean ± SEM) of the width of the apical and basal dendritic arbors of pCIG (N=11) or pCIG-19ICD-HA (N=12) electroporated neurons, determined with the SNT plug in in Fiji.
D. Quantification (mean ± SEM) of the total dendritic length by dendrite order in pCIG (N=11) or pCIG-19ICD-HA (N=12) electroporated neurons, determined with the SNT plug in in Fiji.
E. Sholl analysis of pCIG (N=11) and pCIG-19ICD-HA (N=12) electroporated neurons, determined with the SNT plug in in Fiji.

F. Maximum intensity projections of confocal stacks showing apical and basal dendrites of pCIG and pCIG-19ICD-HA electroporated neurons at high magnification to visualize dendritic spines (63x objective). Fluorescent images have been inverted and are shown in greyscale to improve contrast. Scale bar: 10 μm.
G-I. Quantification (mean ± SEM) of total (G), apical (H) and basal (I) spine density in second order dendrites of pCIG (N=16) and pCIG-19ICD-HA (N=12) electroporated neurons.

Data information: (C, D) N: Individual neuron. No statistically significant differences identified. Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney test for apical and basal dendritic arbors (C); unpaired two-tailed Student’s t-test for orders 1-4, two-tailed Mann-Whitney test for dendrite order 5. Analysis of orders 6 and 7 was not possible due to low numbers (D). (G-I): The average of all dendritic areas analyzed per neuron was used for the analysis of spine density. N: Individual neuron. Statistical analysis: two-tailed Mann-Whitney test for total and basal spine densities (G, I); unpaired two-tailed Student’s t-test for apical spine density (H).
